title: Wackamon
info: Wack-A-Mon implements the use of a FSM. This is used to simplify the code and make the program smoother. Additionally, it implements ajax to include a highscore list.

title: eventador
info: This project seamlessly allows you to make your events more robust and usable. This is done while maintaining standard js syntax and backwards compatibility.

title: lewibs-keylogger
info: This keylogger was created to help save development time when the users actions needed to be verified or logged.

title: Tic-Tac-Toe
info: This was made for a matlab TA interview. It was not intended to involve machine learning, but now that has been implemented, and the program uses past games to improve upon itself.

title: Sheet-O-Matic
info: This game gives you an unfair advantage in CLUE as it looks back through past guesses and uses logic to determine who did the crime.

title: Movie Night Etc.
info: Movie Night Etc was part of an elaborate joke to make a blog. I taught myself PHP to make this website. This website is what introduced me to web development.

title: ducktyper
info: This is a project that allows type checking in javascript without needing to add typscript.

title: Wisdom Dog
info: I made the wisdom dog to experiment with interactive websites and see how babble works. It was my first website using the basics.

title: usability-tracker
info: While reading the book, Don't Make Me Think, I was hit with this idea. It is a program that tracks the user movment and actions and allows saving them and playing them back.

title: metamadness
info: Metamadness is my own varient of black eye. Rather then only making a phishing attack, this also updates the meta tags to appear as it's going to a specific link.
